entry.title: a Catholic church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that two European missionaries stationed in a Catholic church (pictured) were beheaded by Chinese Red Army soldiers led by Mao Zedong in 1935?

entry.title: Felipe Lara (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Felipe Lara's Pulitzer finalist Double Concerto turns its soloists into a "many-tentacled creature"?

entry.title: more uniform in appearance (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that birds have more species than mammals, but are relatively more uniform in appearance?

entry.title: Ryoko Kui (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that in addition to her popular manga series Delicious in Dungeon, Ryoko Kui has drawn fan art of the games Baldur's Gate, Pathfinder and Planescape: Torment?

entry.title: Eurovision Song Contest 1974 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one Italian broadcaster delayed airing Eurovision Song Contest 1974 by two months to avoid influencing an upcoming divorce law referendum?

entry.title: Jude McAtamney (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Irish Gaelic footballer Jude McAtamney became interested in American football after reading a Twitter post in 2020, and became an NFL player in 2024?

entry.title: Episode 8851 (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Tim Robards returned to Neighbours in Episode 8851, two years after he had to quit his role early?

entry.title: Franz Liszt (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Franz Liszt's female admirers would fight over his cigar stubs and coffee dregs as souvenirs?
